intro: Eriocaulon pterosepalum, commonly known as the slender spathulate flat-sheath sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its reproductive structures are adapted for wind pollination, a common trait among sedges. Eriocaulon pterosepalum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of wetland ecosystems.
